Contacts documentation¶

Add your content using reStructuredText syntax. See the reStructuredText documentation for details.

REST API main¶

async main.healthchecker(db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

Health Check API. This API checks if the database is running and accessible.

params: db: SQLAlchemy AsyncSession: The database session to be used for the query.

Returns:

dict: A dictionary with a message indicating the health status. If the database is not accessible, it will return an error message.

main.index(request: Request)¶
async main.startup()¶

REST API routes Contacts¶

async src.routes.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactSchema, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Create a new contact.

This endpoint allows the authenticated user to create a new contact.

Parameters:

  • body (ContactSchema) – The data for the new contact.

  • db (AsyncSession) – Database session dependency.

  • user (User) – The current authenticated user.

Returns:

The created contact details.

Return type:

ContactResponse

Status 201:

The contact was created successfully.

async src.routes.contacts.delete_contact(contact_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Delete a contact by its ID.

This endpoint allows the authenticated user to delete a contact.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to delete (must be greater than or equal to 1).

  • db (AsyncSession) – Database session dependency.

  • user (User) – The current authenticated user.

Returns:

No content on successful deletion.

Return type:

None

Status 204:

The contact was deleted successfully.

async src.routes.contacts.get_all_contacts(limit: int = Query(10), offset: int = Query(0), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Retrieve all contacts with pagination support.

This endpoint retrieves a list of contacts for the authenticated user, with support for pagination through limit and offset query parameters.

Parameters:

  • limit (int) – The maximum number of contacts to return (default is 10, minimum is 10, maximum is 500).

  • offset (int) – The number of contacts to skip before starting to collect the result set (default is 0, minimum is 0).

  • db (AsyncSession) – Database session dependency.

  • user (User) – The current authenticated user.

Returns:

A list of contacts.

Return type:

list[ContactResponse]

async src.routes.contacts.get_contact(contact_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Retrieve a specific contact by its ID.

This endpoint retrieves a contact for the authenticated user based on the provided contact ID.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to retrieve (must be greater than or equal to 1).

  • db (AsyncSession) – Database session dependency.

  • user (User) – The current authenticated user.

Raises:

HTTPException – If the contact is not found, a 404 status code is returned.

Returns:

The contact details.

Return type:

ContactResponse

async src.routes.contacts.update_contact(body: ContactUpdateSchema, contact_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Update an existing contact by its ID.

This endpoint allows the authenticated user to update the details of a contact.

Parameters:

  • body (ContactUpdateSchema) – The updated data for the contact.

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to update (must be greater than or equal to 1).

  • db (AsyncSession) – Database session dependency.

  • user (User) – The current authenticated user.

Raises:

HTTPException – If the contact is not found, a 404 status code is returned.

Returns:

The updated contact details.

Return type:

ContactResponse
